useCase.name: Flight authorization from Aviation Regulators

preconditions.precondition: Flight routes and regions are known.

successEndConditions.condition: The UAV is authorized to fly or authorization is denied for a valid reason.

failureEndConditions.condition: The UAV flies outside of authorized limits.

useCase.trigger: Flight routes are planned for current or future missions.

mainSequence.step: The RPIC visually inspects all UAVs prior to takeoff to ensure their flight-worthiness.
The RPIC checks weather conditions for visibility (3 miles), temperature (must be within operating range of the UAV), and other conditions such as wind and precipitation to ensure safe flight.
For each UAV flying in FAA controlled airspace, DroneResponse prepares an authorization request containing the UAV's registration, flight time, and flight region.
DroneResponse connects to an authorization service provider (e.g., AirMap) and requests authorization for a UAV's valid flight plan.
The authorization service provider returns permission to fly, including airspace constraints such as altitude limits and no-fly zones.
DroneResponse marks all airspace restrictions on the map. All subsequent flight paths are checked against these restrictions prior to, and during, each flight.
DroneResponse establishes a geofence that matches the outer boundary of the region for which flight authorization has been received.

esteps.description: The RPIC deems that a UAV is not flight-worthy.
esteps.step: Where feasible, corrections are made to the UAV so that it passes the flight-worthiness test.
Any UAV that is not deemed flight-worthy is removed from the mission.

esteps.description: The RPIC deems weather conditions are unsafe for flight.
Flight authorization is requested for an invalid flight plan (e.g., nighttime flight without a waiver, flying in prohibited airspace).
esteps.step: The RPIC either aborts the mission or replans a valid mission and resubmits a new flight plan.

esteps.description: The authorization service provider fails to respond.
esteps.step: Steps S3 and S4 are repeated at one-minute intervals until a response is received or three attempts have been made.
If no response is received after three attempts, the RPIC manually calls the local Air Traffic Control (ATC) tower to seek flying permission.
If permission is received verbally, the RPIC records this note in the DroneResponse system, and the flight proceeds as authorized.
If permission is not granted by ATC or the authorization service provider, the flight is aborted.

esteps.description: The RPIC has a waiver to fly without prior authorization, typically due to an emergency response authorization.
esteps.step: Steps S3 to S6 are executed in parallel to launching the mission.
